title._content: ["Waveny," Lewis Henry Lapham house, 677 South Avenue, New Caanan, Connecticut. (LOC)

description._content: Johnston, Frances Benjamin,, 1864-1952,, photographer. ["Waveny," Lewis Henry Lapham house, 677 South Avenue, New Caanan, Connecticut. View from house terrace] [ca. 1915] 1 photograph : glass lantern slide, hand-colored ; 3.25 x 4 in. Notes: Site History. House Architecture: William Bunker Tubby, commissioned 1911, built 1912. Landscape: John Charles Olmsted, Olmsted Brothers, 1907 and 1911-1915. Today: House and garden, with changes, extant in Waveny Park. On slide (handwritten): "L" and "Lapham, Mrs. L.H., New Canaan, Conn." Photographed when Frances Benjamin Johnston and Mattie Edwards Hewitt worked together. Title, date, and subject information provided by Sam Watters, 2011. Forms part of: Garden and historic house lecture series in the Frances Benjamin Johnston Collection (Library of Congress). Published in Gardens for a Beautiful America / Sam Watters. New York: Acanthus Press, 2012. Plate 36. Rights Info: No known restrictions on publication. Repository: Library of Congress, Prints and Photographs Division, Washington, D.C. 20540 USA, hdl.loc.gov/loc.pnp/pp.print Higher resolution image is available (Persistent URL): hdl.loc.gov/loc.pnp/ppmsca.16292 Call Number: LC-J717-X108- 78-B
